intro: Psychotria boryana, commonly known as the Bory's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. Psychotria boryana is often found in shaded, humid environments and is an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical forests.
